intro: Pavonia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red bracts that resemble petals, enhancing its ornamental value. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Pavonia latifolia is often used in landscaping for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
